msContents.summary: F-212v: Psalter of the Virgin. : Extensive Opening prayer. : The midpoint is unmarked. Psalm 151 is the short version. : The fourth Biblical Canticle is the Prayer of Hana, mother of Samuel, prophetess. Song of Songs is the common version. Praises of Mary begins with a note about Ephrem, the Syrian, how Our Lady Mary appeared to him on a Monday, and summoned him to praise her, how he protested his inability, how she blessed him and how he opened his mouth and praised her. The Praise of Mary begin on Monday and culminate on Saturday. : Prayer for healing of the eyes, based on Jesus' five words from the cross. Not in Repertoire. Incipit: ሰለም ለአዕይንቲከ ለማርያም በኵራ, written in a different hand. F-213v: Christological teachings (here called መሠረተ ሃይማኖት) from Abuna Marqos, bishop of Ethiopia, to the community of Walatta Ṗeṭros, about the incarnation and trinity, etc., and from bishop ሰዊሮስ ዘእ[ስ]ሙናይ; and from ገብረ እግዚአብሔር to ክርስቶ[ስ] ጳጳስ ዘብሔረ ኢትዮጵያ on the divinity and humanity of Jesus. F-215r: Hymn to Mary, commonly called “Image of Edom,” መልክዐ፡ ኤዶም፡. Répertoire 221; MG 651ff. F. i v: Three notes, in different hands. Upper: Calendar of the fasting times of the year. Middle: Family geneology. Lower: ʾAsmat prayer for protection from thieves, and the enemy, etc, in a trained hand. F. iii r: ʾAsmat prayer for protection against snow. Illuminations added recently over text. : upper margin, prayer to the memory of the departed, ወልደ ተክለ ሃይማኖት. : Note of ownership: ዘወልደ ተክለ ሃይማኖት, and his wife, ወለተ ገብርኤል, his father, ወልደ ሚካኤል, his mother, ወለተ ንግሥት, his brothers, ወልደ እግዚ'እ, እልደ ጊዮርጊስ, and ወልደ ዘራዓ ቡሩክ. A plea to those who will pray with this Psalter, to remember ወልደ ተክለ ሃይማኖት in prayer. A curse on those who would steal or erase parts of the book. : a pray to "give rest to the soul of ʾabuna ገብረ ማርያም.
